sub_topic: Prove that the union of two sets is a superset of each of the sets.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4, 5}. What is the union of sets A and B, and is it a superset of each set individual set?
message_2:
The union of sets A and B, denoted as A ∪ B, is the set of all elements that are in either A or B or in both. In this case, A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}.

A set C is a superset of a set D if every element of D is also an element of C. In this case, since every element of A and B is also an element of A ∪ B, we can say that A ∪ B is a superset of both sets A and B.
